post.title: Updates & Innovation
post.body:
**Note:** If you're not an off-grid person, pay attention anyway. Because everyone will be living off grid when Israel pretends North Korea set off the EMP nukes.

------------------------------<wbr>------------------------------<wbr>-------

It's been several days. What's going on, conquering Christian army? You good? You healthy, happy, and serving the Lord? Great!

Then I've got something an apocalyptic revelation for you.

Because this email contains a lot of updates and ideas for you. It's not just about problems, but about great, inspiring solutions and generous problem-solvers.

Solutions for your life, for our movement, and for your readers. If you don't have local paper readers, that's okay. I'll show you how to get some.

Communicating about the solution is much more important than than the solution itself, because most great ideas and inventions never spread. If you can't sell ideas, they get lost and stay lost.

In fact, many of the world's greatest ideas are gone or forgotten. They went away to die in someone's garage or basement or backyard or journal. Why? Because those great ideas never found a great communicator.

For example, [Roman concrete](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=1fc121e2b5&e=efe23fe1eb) is amazing. Unlike modern concrete, it gets stronger over time and lasts for thousands of years. If you look for these things, you can find them. People are always bringing back lost, old technology.

The dart-throwing [atlatl](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=ed37cbdbd7&e=efe23fe1eb) has been around for ages. But it's finally being rediscovered by people who know how to showcase it. How to demonstrate it. How to make it look and sound amazing and useful, easy to make and use. Which it is. One of the first accurate, reliable ways to kill animals from a distance in one hit.

I'm sure we all have our favorite ancient weapons. But it's not the invention that counts. It's been around for 40,000 years. But it wasn't made as famous as the slingshot David used to take down Goliath. An atlatl would have done the same job.

But the best communicator wins.

Great communicating, [Salatin says](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=93d90146f7&e=efe23fe1eb) (or marketing ideas), means telling stories. I've never been the greatest story-teller, but I'm a curator of solutions whose story must be told.

By re-making our lives to be more independent, powerful, healthy, wealthy, and efficient, we're free to live or to lead. Properly equipped, we can accomplish more in 2 hours per day than a dozen men working all day with the wrong tools.

We can reduce our stress and/or develop the tools and systems and circumstances to build a worldwide community to save our people.

Re-thinking and redesigning our lives through the wisdom of crowds, the products of crowd-sourcing, and the community-created and co-created lifestyles, equipment, and technology our people have developed that's relevant to making you free, taking out the stress, and preparing you for the battle that matters.

The battle for your life.

That's what this email is about. Once you're free of your burdens of a Jew-led life plan, you're free to fight and lead effectively.

It's time to think differently, and to think bigger. As Local Motors CEO Jay Rogers puts it, we have an obligation to be great.

I'll start with housekeeping:

*   This email list is snowballing in growth.
*   I was asked for quick start tips. Here the are.
*   The status on shirts... if you haven't gotten yours yet.
*   Where your physical newsletter is, if you ordered one.

Then we'll get to these innovations, and why you need to know about them:

![](https://ci6.googleusercontent.com/proxy/lULDyti97GrV6aDkmEdsPCA3cUzdq41w64diuZpOQuPi29xMzYnGJg_yKQcNIk0kCbqZitZiXdoozRnXVZ59UqfBXe5wYZ8_vzIPXqaZrhwLsEv1qpCt1CIT9XcvvbFsN66q1yyrOFvHjAtm19Hqu2ZKkjwuNzInRyBMn3Q=s0-d-e1-ft#https://gallery.mailchimp.com/8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952/images/16fbd884-cef7-4a1a-a357-22aaa611b153.jpg)

*   No BS apocalypse-proof off-grid living for about one eighth as much as you probably thought.

*   Apocalypse-resistant hermit home (and getaway)

*   High occupancy urban communes (even if you're not a communist)

*   Cost-effective, efficient air power with no runway, airstrip, or road required. The state of license-free ultralight vertical takeoff and landing for the consumer today.

*   Censorship-free, anonymous technology to intelligently organize for serious achievements.

*   YourWardNews Fall 2017 is trying to bring Jews to Jesus before their time runs out.

*   Collaborative, digital manufacturing, open-source hardware, homes, vehicles, aircraft, and more.

* * *

## Item #1: The Email List:

The rapid, sudden growth of this email list is surprising. It's really been snowballing lately. Thank you for sharing this resource! Feel free to forward it. I'm consciously keeping some of the "racist" JQ ranting to a minimum for you today, and keeping the value high. You can be among the first to spread it around, or you can be known as the guy who didn't.

Today's email is the kind of resource I wish more people would make. A dense combination of related ideas which cross over traditional boundaries. It's about paradigm-shifting ideas and the kinds of systems and teams that built them. Apparently, it's now possible to do crowd-sourced research and development work in a profitable startup.

In other words, it's what I want these emails to be.

Like the book Abundance, by Peter Diamandis, or many of the greatest Ted Talks, it's a the re-combination combination of ideas (or as Matt Ridley puts it, when ideas have sex), that the greatest and smallest breakthroughs happen.

It's by putting more minds on a problem that it's solved most elegantly.

More than 50,000 minds came together to bring new vehicles like the Rally Fighter and Ollie to market 5 times faster, with 100 times less capital, with build times that are 68 times quicker (4 man hours instead of 275 man hours) with 14 times fewer parts, disrupting an entire industry by combining brain power. Two heads are better than one.

Oh, and by the way, the cost of the end product, Ollie, a self-driving shuttle van, was 5 times less expensive than the traditional industrial approach.

This is why, for the sake of all mankind, tradition must die. We're not following rabbinical traditions of the Pharisees anymore. We're guerilla revolutionaries when it comes to the cutting edge methods and technologies that blast open the floodgates to our conquest. We're not living in the past. We're bringing about an unrealized dream. And we need the right tools to get us there.

I'm not interested in the products, but in the production. I'm not interested in the state of disruption today, but what technology will enable us to disrupt tomorrow.

Migrate or die. Not to new lands, but to new ways of thinking. New ways, tools, and collaborative paradigms. We've got the greatest incentive there is. An end to poverty, crime, unemployment, even disease. But more than that, an easier, healthier, happier life for future generations.

New or old, we're looking for whatever serves the interests of our people.

Because in a few short years, since the Rally Fighter was introduced as a new, street-legal rally racecar, Local Motors has quietly been even more disrupting to the auto industry than Tesla by re-defining what it means to be a car company.

It's been has by playing in a small, experimental space with [micro-manufacturing](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=413e90527d&e=efe23fe1eb), making dreams come true by bringing more products to market in less time, such as a designing self-driving shuttle bus in 2 and a half months or a completed flying cargo drone designed from the ground up and built to specifications in 27 days using digital manufacturing.

For the first time, people can actually get the car they want. And they don't have to wait.

An unintended consequence is people are able to design and build entirely new classes of custom vehicles with cutting edge technology without a college degree.

And get paid for it.

Oh, and also aircraft, by the way. Because why not? And also Mars exploration technology, since an amazing co-creation and collaboration tool set is the real revolution Local Motors has refined and implemented. It can be used for anything you can imagine. And appliance prototypes. Why not? New digital manufacturing techniques and tools make it possible and reasonably affordable.

Like a lot of open source projects, but with rewards. With the design of the facilities and tooling included as projects to consider.

In other words, Local Motors is a customer of its own services. They'll even collaboratively crowd-source the speech writing. Genius. Other than the laws of the universe, the only limit is your imagination.

It's not the only open-source, transparent car company. There are more than a dozen. Wikispeed, for example. And other open hardware projects.

Several open source projects [cutting-edge houses](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=3713a36554&e=efe23fe1eb) loaded with aquaponics, disaster-proofing, fast and affordable to build, very low total cost of ownership, and longevity.

Open collaboration isn't just for software. It never was.

![](https://ci3.googleusercontent.com/proxy/KB-z1zqoIWWCXONgfpuysG404DMJckBhfs94nlSlYMcSjNd5lVZjycFzUtoh-ujfomssgBuFnjUzPksjptm8SxQtqCPLwEQLJMNLW1Nob5othz8Yx-b0jUTMONylW7inxDjV8FDCTrvn5EChxNi10TXn0JcMLvpEDyMPL5k=s0-d-e1-ft#https://gallery.mailchimp.com/8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952/images/6948d8c9-6258-428a-9a4f-26997ec25ecd.jpg)

The open-source Global Village Construction Set happens to be modular. But its philosophy comes from the school of thinking which produced the tiny house movement. Which was never about living small, but about living free from debt to Jewish bankers, freedom from electric and grocery bills and career tracks.

They want the ability to survive and prosper and pursue happiness when society's trusted institutions inevitably betray us. As their universities did. This is the work of doctors. Ph.D.s who just wanted to be farmers, but their tools failed them.

I know it's a poor craftsman who blames his tools, but in this case, the crony capitalist monopoly system keeps us all on the hamster wheel of over-priced, broken technology which was built to fail from the start.

Henry Ford found success by taking the opposite approach to business. Giving people the cheapest and best car he could. A car you could fix with your own tools.

Inspired by Ford, a certain German leader designed a "folk's wagon" car to do something similar. Today, we call his plan the beetle. And adjusted for inflation, it cost about the same as the Model T. It's domed shape gave it less surface area and better aerodynamics. A savings on steel and fuel.

These kinds of revolutions come from a desire to rebel against every short-sighted, profit-seeking executive trying to make a name for himself, every foolish banker and investor, every union and regulator and stock broker who interferes with our moral obligation to give human beings the best deal we can, and trusting that it's the right thing to do, and that God will reward us for thinking like a white man.

Which is true. This is exactly what history teaches us.

Everyone who cuts corners cuts his own throat, and realizes it too late. When Japan and Russia and China were new to international commerce, they all made the same mistakes that a young and eager commissioned salesman does, playing in the grey areas to make a sale.

When leaders tolerate this kind of dishonesty, it kills the culture, drives away the best and the brightest, the sanest and wisest. They're off like a shot. They sell their stock and might even sell the company short, knowing any success they have can't last.

The quicker you flee a sinking ship, the sooner you make it to shore.

The innovators are uncompromising, demanding, disciplined, focused, obsessing on achieving a greater life for the end user.

They're hard to work for, because they refuse to accept anything but your best. Anything else would be a betrayal. They don't run a charity. They run a business. And the best don't tolerate someone soft-headed enough to keep a lot of traitors around who make it their mission to sabotage everyone's best efforts.

There's no conspiracy theory involved. Your dishonest competitors aren't sending infiltrators to sabotage your business, they're not doing the job they're hired to do. Either win, or make the other guys lose. When both companies do this, they both lose their best talent. Your best guys won't work for either company.

Giving anything less then your best is betraying yourself. Taking or keeping the wrong job, or working for people who want to destroy you.

The best are here because they've seen communism wreck a country. They've fled that evil for freedom. They've lived through that disaster. A nation, an empire, or a civilization being shipwrecked for a buck. It's as if everyone's walking around on blistering hot rocks and the volcano is about to erupt and they're the only ones suggesting maybe shoes would be a good idea.

These new entrepreneurs, who came to America for freedom, see the volcanic, ashen storm clouds on the horizon, full of thunder and lightning. It seems like no one else sees it. They're too busy perfecting their twerking as the burning coals begin to rain down from heaven.

These visionary entrepreneurs see a problem the masses don't see, and want to make it easier for the farmer, the builder with vital tools like the automated brick press. It makes you mobile. Pack it in a truck and go and you could build a little shed-sized house in a day from the dirt under your feet and a cheap bag of cement or two. A little shelter that could last for 50 years or more.

A mechanized homesteader can buy up acres and make their living by working the soil part time. Everyone who pulls a dozen [chicken tractors](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=80abc71021&e=efe23fe1eb) or a heavy [egg mobile](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=13a5cd6c83&e=efe23fe1eb) by hand should use machines, not muscles. Hitch up the horsepower. That's what it's for.

An off-grid community can be a marketplace and a profit center. It doesn't need to be lonely or isolated or full of paranoid gun nuts or hunters living in bomb shelters. From what I've seen, that's mostly a media-made myth.

![](https://ci5.googleusercontent.com/proxy/6X4j1h6kNWcWA37Y7JHCAKqJ-rn1SEE82oIYzi4sY4CC0Iuyk14JlWRick7KqJ8QTJg46OcElk-Ncy7gSLDtskINjeTOXRHQ9etPmnwghh8GTVBQnZ0CJQR-7zaRIUnQNfdY4LMee5gwg7rvYtXU6lHVN57qpGLo_cwuuEs=s0-d-e1-ft#https://gallery.mailchimp.com/8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952/images/b3c4d0e6-e231-4945-b893-e8e8ed2527e0.jpg)

If this speaks to you, you can [get informed](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=b86d0297d5&e=efe23fe1eb), get equipped, start [charging rent](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=4ed32a5957&e=efe23fe1eb) or selling food. Communities are inter-dependent.

Now, a little-known secret. The American dream comes from getting along with your neighbors. If you've got that and access to cheap, durable tools, no credit line is required. You don't need a credit card to get a job. You don't need a mortgage to rent an apartment, a plot of farmland, or a piece of equipment.

I'd rather rent a $9,000 tractor for the day than a $70,000 tractor that does the same job. Or you could buy a cheap used tractor that someone sold for good reason. Because it costs more to fix it than it costs to replace it.

If you can buy it 8 times cheaper, or build it 8 times cheaper, then you can rent it 8 times cheaper.

And if you own cheap, ugly things, its not as enticing to thieves, and you've lost a lot less when the government or your ex-wife's lawyer or a neighbor or invader steals it from you. In really bad times, it's better to sell all you've got and give the money to the poor.

Open source hardware is made possible by leveraging the bottomless well of pathological altruism which fuels all open-source movement to this day.

Some contributors want to make it possible to survive the coming storm. If we don't return to God, we're in real trouble. If I'm right, and enough people listen, a correct prophecy is indistinguishable from a false alarm. It's like warning people to get away from the bear or it will attack. If they listen, the bear will seem like it was harmless all along.

If people don't change their ways (as they've been doing), then these problems will escalate even sooner. As Jesus said, without Him, no one would survive the firestorm that's coming. You might stall it for another generation, in which case you'll get no credit for doing so, but only ridicule.

That's why you can't stop it, even if you want to. The best you can do is delay it and survive it. But you can't count on anyone but yourself and those who care about you to give you what you need.

With the sawmill, the tractor, tiller, and backhoe attachment, a brick press, a combine, a welder, all made from a common erector set and assembled or repaired in an hour, built in as little as a day, a settlement or village with a set of 50 tools (which fit in a shipping container) can sustain itself without help from the outside world.

When everyone else is struggling to survive, they can sustain themselves working as little as 2 hours a day, establishing themselves at a fraction of the cost and labor of buying or building a traditional house, and without going into debt to a bank and running the risk of losing the farm.

By combining minds and methods from around the world, they're building better, cheaper, more durable than factory-bought, built to meet or exceed industry standards, and leverage on-site materials. Need sophisticated electronics to run the rig? No problem. The software's free. The hardware's relatively cheap.

![http://opensourceecology.org/w/images/thumb/7/70/IMAG1537.jpg/500px-IMAG1537.jpg](https://ci3.googleusercontent.com/proxy/x6_NGdbK92d3hJOJqKp-iTu8PCBvpVWlCjX3MIJTavB6IoF8u-ZLdSoD9fusB1UieEc27hpI4JJwlAKDK1ub_Sb5G4hoSksqWsCs4EnGBTW2LEmDep83JVK6f4eiRyKhUr8_UhdK=s0-d-e1-ft#http://opensourceecology.org/w/images/thumb/7/70/IMAG1537.jpg/500px-IMAG1537.jpg)

We're almost, but not quite at the point where we can cast our own open-source engines from precision-cast aluminum blocks.

One way or another, an open-source power train is coming. And there are reasons why big companies would want to contribute to the project. For the same reasons big companies contribute to open source software projects.

In the meantime, these machines work now. They're used, tested, and the LifeTrac is already on version 6\. Part of the modular dirt-pusher erector set. They've been making money on something they build from free designs and instructions. So can you. Why?

Because you could build your own and sell it, or you could pay someone else to build it for you, and profit from using it, immediately saving about 6 times what it costs to buy a comparable tractor from anyone else.

What's the killer power plant? It starts at 17 horsepower. They found it was much more economical to use two $299 engines in series than to buy one with twice the horsepower. But if that changes, or your needs change, you can swap in a different engine. Or plug in an extra. Multiple engines work together. They're plug-and-play by design.

All the equipment works with any compatible power plant you want to plug into it. And they're using standardized power plants so you're not buying a completely new machine for every single task.

It's like you're building your own farm equipment with a Lego kit. The attachments aren't proprietary. They're designed to be worked on. To be easily swapped out in a few minutes with a standard crescent wrench. They want it to last 100 years. You don't have to take it in for warranty service. Tips To Start Make Money Fast in Local Media:
------------------------------<wbr>------------------------------<wbr>-

One of you guys asked about a good starting point for local media. He seemed interested in getting up and running quickly.

The first law of business is to sell first, collect payment upfront, and then deliver.

First of all, pre-sell, up-sell. But the most important thing is to sell. Get orders in hand, even checks in hand. Do a manual Kick-Start launch. (There was a time before computers, you know.) You can let people know you'll deposit their payments once you hit threshold, or that you'll refund them if you don't.

In theory, it's not that hard. The prospecting and sales might be or seem laborious, but quite frankly, if you have your materials ready to go, like the postal routes you intend to cover from the USPS EDDM site and the demographic data they provide you and a printed price list, then you're all set.

For your price list, look at what competitors are charging an do likewise. Google it. Every time you make a sale, offer your up-sell. Those insertions cost next to nothing, so make the most of it. If you've got a $250, you should be able to turn it into a $1,000 sale (some of the time) if you add enough value. And that about doubles the amount of money you're making per-appointment.

Actually, the numbers can be much larger than this, but I try to keep numbers small and believable, since your ability won't be the same as someone else's.

If you're a nerd like me, you're going to send them to a YouTube video demonstrating your product and service. And if it's 20 minutes long, that's fine. It's very easy to get people to show up to an education-based YouTube marketing video.

It's hard to get a meeting in their office. You've got better positioning when they come to you. So when you smile and dial, offer to send an educational email on getting more business. At the end of the video, you can let them know how to buy from you, and follow-up with a series of educational sales emails or videos to double your sales over time.

I can't exactly prescribe a solution without knowing your experience and the kind of environment you're working in, so I do have a discord channel so you can pick my brain.

I did send you guys the link so you could get help. Hopefully you're using it.

But here are some more general startup tips:

Client source #1: Your own flyers.

If you can't get business by sending out flyers, then you probably shouldn't be offering to send out flyers. The point is, it works.

Some say simpler works better. If you're selling [lawn mowing services](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=df06445616&e=efe23fe1eb), this is probably true. One of my ultra-desperate fallback plans, assuming I turn out to be the wrong kind of person to thrive anywhere in media, and assuming I'd rather die by shooting myself with a [modern-day street sweeper](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=6929e1f2da&e=efe23fe1eb) than slave away at Labor Ready or some temp agency, is running a window cleaning or landscaping or [micro-construction](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=ccadf7b7f4&e=efe23fe1eb) subcontractor business long enough to buy myself a little piece of paradise somewhere.

It turns out, I'm not the kind of person who's thrilled about working half my life to pay for an inefficient house so some ex-wife can take it in the divorce. This doesn't strike me as a good life plan.

By the way, the window washing business really [scales big](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=d2ceca87f4&e=efe23fe1eb) when you figure out how to grow it. And that's where having your own media company can help. As you can imagine, there were a number of advantages to operating that way. The usual regulations did not apply.

BUILD A DISASTER-PROOF HOUSE OR SHELTER

*   Hurricane-proof, [disaster-proof housing technology](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=17f8743e02&e=efe23fe1eb) is here, lasts 150 years, and costs less to build, own, and maintain.

The secret to surviving a hurricane is . Insurance premiums are a tiny fraction in a less expensive, properly-designed home. Hurricane-proof, dome-shaped concrete (and [foam-based aircrete](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=47656bf9c9&e=efe23fe1eb)) shelters and homes start as low as $2,000 - $9,000\. Look into that. They're resistant to all kinds of disasters, and don't need a layer of paint, then siding, then insulation, then interior, then paint. Insulating, light, strong, reinforced concrete in nature's most durable shape

A well-built concrete (or [aircrete](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=c990e1d3e6&e=efe23fe1eb)) dome home (or dome shelters) have been known to stop a [30 caliber rifle round](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=05411e66e2&e=efe23fe1eb), to [survive wildfires](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=78ba508204&e=efe23fe1eb), floods, hurricanes, comfortably survive Alaskan arctic cold equivalent to 55 below zero without any internal heating for days, fireproof enough to reduce insurance premiums to a tiny fraction of the cost, cut heating bills in half compared to traditional homes of the same square footage, don't leak, build fast & at a fraction of the cost of other options, survive wildfires rolling right over the top of them with little more than cosmetic damage, aren't made of termite food, don't rot, don't necessarily reduce property values in the area, and in general, if you're replacing a home that just got blown over by a hurricane, they're a much more intelligent option than rebuilding traditional home.

And the annual homeowner's insurance can be about an eighth as much as traditional construction, because [it can't burn down.](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=e0375323d1&e=efe23fe1eb)

Fire-proof houses play well with wood heat like clean, efficient [rocket stoves](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=ea91fc8c3e&e=efe23fe1eb), (or an even more sophisticated, pellet-fed [rocket mass heater](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=d614659df9&e=efe23fe1eb)) and especially if you if you [channel its exhaust pipe through a thermal mass](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=f4ef3a893f&e=efe23fe1eb), is plenty to heat a [properly designed house](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=3e2c4d100d&e=efe23fe1eb) for days after the fire's gone out.

In addition, the concrete in your home acts as a thermal battery to evens out the temperatures. And if it's built into the ground, you're protected from wind and cold snaps. Just a foot beneath the surface, the ground stays at a constant 50 degrees. In hot weather, you passively cool the home with ducting routed through dirt, letting hot air escape out through the skylight. And then you've got free passive air conditioning, completely off the grid. Like [this $50 solar home](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=8dcc00694e&e=efe23fe1eb).

For the same reasons, they heat their greenhouse all winter with a hot compost pile. Why? Because it's free heat.

It's a very good sales pitch for an often disappointing product. It avoided solving the real problem by ignoring the crucial innovation called aircrete, which makes it fast, cheap, to build incredibly strong, efficient, bug-resistant, rot-free permanent, expandable, disaster-proof structures of every shape and size. All you need is a foaming wand and a mixer, and that's it. Not 2 years of pounding dirt with a sledgehammer.

The men who love their little homes forever are those who build a little hermit hole in a hillside, which they "rent" from the state for $100 a year, paying nothing but property taxes for it.

That's something one man can do. He can find a crevice in a south-facing hillside, pour a cement floor, install some windows scrounged up from a broken down RV, and have an all-season home heated by a fire pit outside the bedroom window.

And that's a start. Technically, a teepee is a start, probably insulated by a wrap of breathable sheeps wool, (because moisture buildup is a problem in small, enclosed spaces), heated by a fire at first, then a little cooking stove. At this point, if you've got a creek nearby, you're living well enough to build what you need.

The next step is a storm-proof or at least a weather-proof small, temporary shelter of some kind to live in while building. Maybe for years.

An insulated yurt can get you through the winter and summer while you're building up your more ambitious homestead. But it doesn't need to be too ambitious to be a step up from a yurt.

These are subjects which might be interesting to your local paper readers. I can

Our people used outhouses for centuries. It's not that a big deal. But we've massively improved on it. There are incinerating and composting toilets. (Not necessarily recommended.)

These days, we're so spoiled by indoor plumbing that you pretty much have to figure out how to move in the direction of a septic system or you'll slightly hate your otherwise phenomenally liberating, low-stress life without the complete and constant madness of the collapse of civilization.

But with your own land and property, you'll be in a position where the collapse of civilization, while very noticeable, won't be anywhere near as much of a hardship for you. More importantly, knowing the path to quickly acquire and develop cheap land, build a temporary shelter in a matter of days, and gradually expand that into a permanent house over time.

Now that you know how to [live like a hermit for $1,000](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=610b3ec764&e=efe23fe1eb) (or just trick chicks into thinking you do, while your real apartment is [downtown](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=80d1c37676&e=efe23fe1eb), unlike your typical ["traveling" hobo hippies](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=96f6989c63&e=efe23fe1eb)) let's move on to a more social way of living.

You'll learn about [crowd-powered](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=6cfdcd562a&e=efe23fe1eb) development using [open source](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=ab303fb2e4&e=efe23fe1eb) and [building communities](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=108b8991fb&e=efe23fe1eb) beyond yourself.

------------------------------<wbr>---------------
Extroverts: Commune Style Living
------------------------------<wbr>----------------

Because it would be good to have food independence, right?

A man or a couple can live small. But you can also build an more efficient, mobile, modular [efficient, mobile, modular, urban](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=3bf8f2725b&e=efe23fe1eb) or rural [community](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=a3ea209eff&e=efe23fe1eb) in [style](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=f0ac2ffe6b&e=efe23fe1eb) or comfort. Or somewhere in between.

Or figure out about working within the [financing, zoning, and code limitations](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=f03bf9def3&e=efe23fe1eb) to create more efficient [tinyhouse suburban micro-communities](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=589a5484bd&e=efe23fe1eb) or [urban communities](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=391ed2203e&e=efe23fe1eb) or [mechanized cooperative farming and building](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=82bf3bb0d2&e=efe23fe1eb) with [semi-automated seeding](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=4575092368&e=efe23fe1eb) and [harvesting](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=f7b26ae627&e=efe23fe1eb), IRL Farmville-style solutions that didn't exist ten years ago, without the back-breaking labor or startup expense of traditional agriculture.

You may have heard of high-density [urban farming](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=9d18b36616&e=efe23fe1eb), producing $100,000 on a quarter acre of someone else's yard, rented for vegetables, which are sold to nearby stores and restaurants.

You can start a small farm with very little money, starting with the basics, for $5,000 or less. And then you can decide if you want high-profit crops or high-calorie crops.

To sustain the soil, Joel Salatin created a wiser system which [builds up topsoil](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=0cb598452a&e=efe23fe1eb) and biomass as you use the land. Herbivores heal the land. That means being smart about using animals like pigs, chickens, dogs, rabbits, and cattle. For example, "chicken tractors" break the pathogen cycle keeping chickens and cattle moving every day. Because a productive farm shouldn't smell like a sewer.

The importance of farming right: It typically takes a civilization about 800 years for a civilization to use up the topsoil. Then it collapses. On un-managed land, there was no shortage of bison before our ancestors arrived to the U.S. Through smarter management, we can actually improve on nature's productivity.

Food forests are about planting once, having food forever (Bit be very careful of the Jews in the permaculture space. Know your nightshades, and don't mix different kinds of seed in the same bed, or someone can poison and even enslave you, just as they did in ancient times. I think that's what all the fasting is about in the Bible. Pretend to eat your slave porridge, but don't eat it, and Jesus will have set you free from a hell on earth.)

------------------------------<wbr>-----------
AIR POWER
------------------------------<wbr>-----------

"Then they will see the Son of Man coming in the clouds with great power and glory."

*   Mark 13:26

How do you get cost-effective, efficient air power with no runway, airstrip, or road needed?

The state of license-free ultralight vertical takeoff and landing is available for the consumer today. And through LocalMotors, we can design, prototype, and mass-produce the [street](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=0a248820a9&e=efe23fe1eb) and [air vehicles](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=92b8493b82&e=efe23fe1eb) we need in months, not years.

(Someone tell the Post Office. Their fleet is dying.)

Ultralight autogyros [start at about $10,000](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=3462331c88&e=efe23fe1eb). This one's modified to demonstrate VTOL capabilities, able to leap 150 feet in the air without a runway.

[http://www.cartercopters.com/<wbr>trainer](http://www.cartercopters.com/trainer)

But the closest thing to a flying car is the [Carter Personal Air Vehicle](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=ff0c98edf9&e=efe23fe1eb). Part plane, part autogyro, acts like a [faster, safer, more efficient, easier-to-fly](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=76e235158f&e=efe23fe1eb) helicopter. It stores enough energy in the rotor to make a normal landing without power.

There are [other innovations possible](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=0d69134130&e=efe23fe1eb) to exceed 450 knots (by completely stopping the rotor at high speed). But most people still can't imagine how you'd [take off on a one-bladed prop](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=803d5541ca&e=efe23fe1eb), or how stopping it enables higher speeds[by reducing drag](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=32340553b4&e=efe23fe1eb).

------------------------------<wbr>-----------
THE END OF CENSORSHIP
------------------------------<wbr>-----------

*   Censorship-free, anonymous technology to intelligently organize for serious achievements.

I've mentioned [Zeronet.io](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=e698bd9a67&e=efe23fe1eb), the distributed internet system that's blocked in China, but still used in China. In other words, it's a legitimate threat to totalitarian power. Then again, so is a photocopier.

Better things are coming in the near future, based on [another technology](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=95034eeafd&e=efe23fe1eb). But with zeronet, I've already had up to 20 re-broadcasters "hosting" my site for my new [nationalist blog](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=84f3055e4b&e=efe23fe1eb), and several for the new [kikepedia](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=5efcf12c90&e=efe23fe1eb), a user-editable wiki for listing and categorizing Jewish crimes in a central database. Since it's automatically decentralized by visitors using the cross-platform, open-source zeronet app, the information can't be easily taken down, as long as someone wants it. It's sandboxed in an iframe for security. Maybe a little too much security, since I can't get embedded YouTube videos to play on my blog.

But it's neat to finally have the technology I've been waiting for. It's like a web browser for bittorrent sites. Freenet was a valiant attempt at doing this, and it's still up and running, but it delivers a slow experience, and never really caught on as big as zeronet did. What's missing from zeronet is a clearnet bridge.

* * *

## NOW WHAT?

Now you're aware of the technology and some of the re-invention of the process of innovation. What one possible future looks like, and who's very seriously doing something about it.

You can take this information and decide to earn $500 a day cleaning windows or $1,000 a day doing landscaping. You can prepare by getting an electric generator, or prepare for the day when nobody has a a working electric generator when they need one.

The courts in the United States are already operating like a third-world country. It's a matter of time before the inevitable economic collapse comes. The economy is built on a house of cards. You can expect hyperinflation. Probably in our lifetime.

Who will come to your rescue? Have you built community among your neighbors? Is there anything you agree on? Or have you chosen to live among people with no common purpose?

If you still don't know how important agriculture is, and the ability to find and make your own food, then you may need to see [Connections, Episode 1](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=a070df7c9e&e=efe23fe1eb).

If you don't know and feel how closely we, as humans, are intimately tied to what comes from the soil, then you won't be prepared when the topsoil is used up, when the oil runs out, or, more likely, when the tentacles of communism suffocates our fatherland.

------------------------------<wbr>-----------
Final bit of news:
------------------------------<wbr>-----------

For fans of anti-Marxist local media, the new [<u>YourWardNews</u>](https://fuelingtheresistance.us15.list-manage.com/track/click?u=8696dfca55b8360feafbeb952&id=6bb23e4d9d&e=efe23fe1eb) is out. That's always worth checking out. I just read it for the articles, of course. Not for the biting editorial cartoons.

post.body:
The clever, tricky devils have plotted to get you to say, "I'm not one of the people who wants to put Jews in the oven." What you may not realize is Christ did.

See for yourself:
​​​​​​​
"The Son of Man will send out His angels, and they will weed out of His kingdom every cause of sin and all who practice lawlessness. [And](http://biblehub.com/greek/2532.htm "2532: kai (Conj) -- And, even, also, namely.") [they will throw](http://biblehub.com/greek/906.htm "906: balousin (V-FIA-3P) -- (a) to cast, throw, rush, (b) often, in the weaker sense: to place, put, drop.") [them](http://biblehub.com/greek/846.htm "846: autous (PPro-AM3P) -- He, she, it, they, them, same.") [into](http://biblehub.com/greek/1519.htm "1519: eis (Prep) -- Into, in, unto, to, upon, towards, for, among.") Jesus also explains "the weeds are the sons of the evil one". And in John 8:44 says of the so called "Jews" (who aren't) are the children of the devil. In any event, those who reject Christ (since they're either with Christ or against Him) serve the devil. Because only by serving the narrow truth can you avoid the web of thousands of lies leading you astray. The gate is narrow, that leads to salvation.

In the Gospel, it's made clear that God is not the author of confusion. True. If you get your scripture from anyone but God directly, through the scripture, you'll be led astray. There's no teacher but the Messiah. None. Believe none but Christ. Then, through his words, you can understand the whole Bible just fine. And the will of God.

Which, IMO, is the same thing as understanding the "will" of nature. Or the consequences of actions. If you got your information from the world's finest historian, the lessons would be identical. The problem is we get normie history and knowledge about the Bible from the devil who hates the Bible.

post.title: Everyone's Race Matters but Ours
post.body:
# Why The Alt-Right Will Win

![way_of_the_world.jpg (634x353)](data/img/post_16_way_of_the_world.jpg)

The Way of the World's new video: predicts the inevitable victory of the Alt-Right. He explains his reasons. One of which is the left can't explain theirs. Based in bitterness, not thought.

Well, this is the surface view of things, but most people still aren't ready for the Babylonian religion of pederasty to be exposed as the antithesis of life, truth, and reason. Too bad they run the world.
